abstracts.cdata!:
The project's objectives are to
            generate foreign exchange and to increase employment by
            expanding industrial output and exports and would consist
            of: (a) an investment promotion program and the construction
            of industrial estates through the BIDC; (b) industrial
            lending for fixed assets and permanent working capital
            through the BDB; (c) promotion of manufactured exports,
            training and marketing assistance to domestic exporters
            through the EPC; (d) management and vocational training for
            industry through BIMAP and the NTB. The project will not be
            subject to any extraordinary risk. BIDC's proposed
            policy for increased rental rates of factory space, to
            enable it to generate a positive rate of return, may reduce
            the demand for space in Barbados. This reduction, however,
            is not expected to be large as the rentals will still be in
            line with those charged by BIDC's competitors in the Caribbean.
